fields.summary: CBO: AST mode checks for TABLESAMPLE with AST.toString().contains("TOK_TABLESPLITSAMPLE")

comments.body: [~pxiong] Could you take a look?
I would prefer a BFS rather than a DFS. And I think it will solve the problem. If it is still an issue, i can try to solve it in the parser level.
A query generator which uses the TPC-DS schemas and generates a 100k item IN() list.

Attached a patch using BFS. However, I doubt it will solve the problem. Previously, I assume that we can save some shift actions between adjacent Ast Nodes because we divide the whole string into small tokens. However, it seems that Java "contains" is based on "indexOf" and its complexity is O(mn) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12752274/java-indexofstring-str-method-complexity. Thus, even after divide, we can not save too much. [~gopalv], could you please try the patch and see if it improves? If not, I will try a parser solution. Thanks.

One other thing, it looks like {{ArrayList<T>.remove}} has a runtime of O(N) (http://infotechgems.blogspot.com/2011/11/java-collections-performance-time.html). If we don't want to use a {{Queue<T>}}, maybe a {{LinkedList<T>}} instead?

Oh sorry. I was talking about this patch with a coworker, and I see now that [~jpullokkaran] was already working on the issue. Sorry about that, this is my first time making a contribution, so I didn't realize I might be stepping on someone else's toes :/.

If you want to use my suggestion, by all means go ahead. Again, sorry about the confusion.
[~Reuben] No need for apologies; i haven't started looking at this.
Oh ok, do you mind if I finish it out then?
Submit your patch, i am happy to review it.
Okay, I think it's up. I really appreciate the help!

[~sircodesalot] I looked at the relevant code and looked at your patch, let me summarize:
The issue with the current code is:
1. It generates string from AST
2. Does search of the full string

Your patch definitely avoids generating string from AST.

I am wondering if there are CommonTree/BaseTree utility classes that may suffice our search requirements (especially if it can use using token ids)?
Okay, new patch up!
Bump.

[~ sircodesalot] How does patch3 improve on patch2?
Other than wrapping AST in a stream i don't see any benefit; also you incur the cost of reflection.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12724539 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Ah I see, I misunderstood your comment. I thought what you were after was something more straightforward. But you really just want:

(1) Some simple utility class that will perform traversal (rather than hand rolling code to do so).
(2) Use the actual Tokens rather than their {{toString}} representations.

#2 Is easy to fix, I see what you're after now, I just misread it.
#1 Is less easy. It looks like there is a way to offload traversal to ANTLR, but after a lot of searching, it looks like the only way to do this is to use 'Tree Pattern Matching' (https://theantlrguy.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ANTLR3/Tree+pattern+matching), which is certainly doable, but requires modifying the parser grammar in addition to applying the pattern matcher class within the {{validateASTForUnsupportedTokens}}).If that's the correct path here, then I can go ahead and get something put together. Just let me know what you think.

Also, it looks like my code is failing for some reason, but I'm looking through the logs/links above, but not seeing why it's failing. All I see is that certain tests are not generating XML files, in addition to this:

{code}
